task_text: Give me a table of skills and their names that I don't have

text_blocks: I have your skills. Now I need to get a complete list of all possible skills in the system. Let me check other employees to gather all skill names.
So far all employees I've checked have the same 15 skills that I have. Let me continue checking more employees from different departments to ensure I capture all possible skills in the system.

All checked employees so far have the same 15 skills. It appears this is the standard skill set in the system. Let me check a few more employees from different departments to confirm there are no additional skills.
Let me check employees from Production, R&D and other departments to ensure no additional skills exist:
Let me check some employees from different departments (IT, HR, Logistics) to complete the survey:

I've now checked employees across multiple departments (Corporate Leadership, Sales, R&D, Production Italy, Production Serbia, Quality & HSE, IT & Digital, Human Resources, and Finance & Administration). All employees consistently have the same 15 skills in the system.

Let me compare the skill set:
- **My skills (Vittorio Alfano):** skill_corrosion, skill_crm, skill_crm_systems, skill_english, skill_german, skill_italian, skill_negotiation, skill_production_planning, skill_progress_admin, skill_project_mgmt, skill_qms, skill_rail, skill_solventborne, skill_technical_coatings, skill_waterborne (15 skills total)

- **Skills in system (from all sampled employees):** The same 15 skills appear in every employee profile.

You have all 15 skills that exist in the system. There are no missing skills.

input.message: You have all skills in the system. There are no skills missing from your profile - you already have all 15 skills that are tracked in the company system.

summary: ok_answer: You have all skills in the system. There are no skills missing from your profile - you already have
